unnormalised: ## Ditch the Cassettes, Yaar! My Thoughts on Music Streaming
normalised: ## Ditch the Cassettes, Yaar! My Thoughts on Music Streaming

unnormalised: Hey everyone! Remember those days painstakingly making mixtapes? Or hoarding CDs from Chandni Chowk, hoping you’d actually like all the songs? I do! But honestly, music streaming has completely changed the game, hasn't it?
normalised: Hey everyone! Remember those days painstakingly making mixtapes? Or hoarding C D s from Chandni Chowk, hoping you’d actually like all the songs? I do! But honestly, music streaming has completely changed the game, hasn't it?

unnormalised: Seriously, think about it. I can be stuck in Bangalore traffic (which, let's be real, is *always*) and access almost any song imaginable right from my phone. From classic Kishore Kumar to the latest banger from Badshah, it's all there! And the best part? No more worrying about scratching my "Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge" CD! (Though, let’s be honest, that CD is a national treasure).
normalised: Seriously, think about it. I can be stuck in Bangalore traffic (which, let's be real, is *always*) and access almost any song imaginable right from my phone. From classic Kishore Kumar to the latest banger from Badshah, it's all there! And the best part? No more worrying about scratching my "Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge" C D! (Though, let’s be honest, that C D is a national treasure).

unnormalised: I recently switched to a premium plan on [Streaming Service Name - replace with a name of your choice] – mainly because I got tired of the ads interrupting my Lata Mangeshkar marathon. Plus, being able to download songs for offline listening is a lifesaver when I’m travelling back home to Lucknow and the internet decides to take a holiday. No more relying on radio signals that fade in and out every 5 km!
normalised: I recently switched to a premium plan on [Streaming Service Name - replace with a name of your choice] – mainly because I got tired of the ads interrupting my Lata Mangeshkar marathon. Plus, being able to download songs for offline listening is a lifesaver when I’m travelling back home to Lucknow and the internet decides to take a holiday. No more relying on radio signals that fade in and out every five kilometer!

unnormalised: Even my Nani, who initially resisted technology like a stubborn mule, is now hooked! She's discovered a whole new world of devotional music on Spotify (or JioSaavn - your call!) and loves creating her own playlists. She even remembers the old songs she used to listen to in college, perhaps at Miranda House! Talk about a transformation!
normalised: Even my Nani, who initially resisted technology like a stubborn mule, is now hooked! She's discovered a whole new world of devotional music on Spotify (or JioSaavn - your call!) and loves creating her own playlists. She even remembers the old songs she used to listen to in college, perhaps at Miranda House! Talk about a transformation!

unnormalised: Of course, there are downsides. Concerns about artist royalties are definitely valid and need to be addressed. And sometimes, navigating the sheer volume of music can be overwhelming. It’s like trying to choose a sweet from a mithai shop in Diwali - too many delicious options!
normalised: Of course, there are downsides. Concerns about artist royalties are definitely valid and need to be addressed. And sometimes, navigating the sheer volume of music can be overwhelming. It’s like trying to choose a sweet from a mithai shop in Diwali - too many delicious options!

unnormalised: But overall, I think music streaming is a major win. It’s made music more accessible and convenient than ever before. What are your favourite music streaming platforms? Let me know in the comments! And which Bollywood song are you currently obsessed with? I need some new recommendations!
normalised: But overall, I think music streaming is a major win. It’s made music more accessible and convenient than ever before. What are your favourite music streaming platforms? Let me know in the comments! And which Bollywood song are you currently obsessed with? I need some new recommendations!
